description.narrative: 'Enhanced support for children, families and institutions leading to equitable access to regulated water, liquid/solid waste management services, with increased knowledge and attitude for hygienic behaviors in urban/peri urban areas

mailing-address.narrative: UNICEF House (Kazanchis - Opposite UNECA/German House) P.O. Box 1169 Addis Ababa

sector.narrative: Sanitation and hygiene - eliminating open defecation in rural communities
WASH - Enabling environment (policies/strategies, coordination, regulation, financing, planning-monitoring-review, sector capacity development and professionalization)
Water supply - peri-urban and urban communities service delivery
Water supply - safety/quality/treatment (including household treatment and safe storage)

description.narrative: Water supply and Sanitation policy, planning and administration

title.narrative: "UNICEF Programmes in Ethiopia (Water Sanitation and Hygiene)
UNICEF Contract Awards through the UN Global Marketplace
2016 Ethiopia: Joint Action Plan implementation in eight water insecure woredas in Afar regional state
2016 Ethiopia: Outcome evaluation of community-led total sanitation and hygiene (CLTSH)
2019 Ethiopia: Formative evaluation of UNICEF Ethiopia Country Program Evaluation Report
Ethiopia 2019 Annual Report on Results for Children
Ethiopia Country Office 2020 Annual Report on Results for Children

condition.narrative: Should contribute directly to results for children as outlined in the UNDAF, national results and/or UNICEF Strategic Plan and within the scope defined in the CPD, CPAP, OMP or other agreed upon programme documents

title.narrative: 'Enhanced support for children, families and institutions leading to equitable access to regulated water, liquid/solid waste management services, with increased knowledge and attitude for hygienic behaviors in urban/peri urban areas

description.narrative: An estimated 344,00 Women, Men, girls and boys in 8 small/medium towns have improved access to WASH services as a result of the UNICEF Ethiopia urban WASH programme that provided a full package of services (water supply, solid/liquid waste management, hygiene and utility management capacity development). A new project on “Durable WASH services” in three (Bule, Bidre and Doyo Gena) towns in Southern Ethiopia with a new Woreda-wide approach is now in progress. | Status:Partially Met | As-of Date:30/06/2020

title.narrative: #of users from new connections/ services of safely managed, water supply and sanitation services (for liquid and solid waste) in urban, peri-urban areas, for refugees and host communities including institutions

actual.value: 2020:• 21,000 people (10,458 female and 10,542 male) are provided with piped water supply that are connected to HHs or from water points. • 1 Safely managed water supply service is constructed for Abomsa town. • 3 schools were provided with WASH facilities with direct UNICEF contribution

title.narrative: Water safety plan implemented at community level

actual.value: 2020:CR-WSP trainings were conducted in Wukro, Sheno, Abomsa, Maksegnit and Welenchiti. Training in Kebridehar is planned for first quarter of 2020. Five towns out of seven which is 71%

title.narrative: Percentage of schools with water supply (urban)

actual.value: 2020:Data will be available by end of September 2020.

title.narrative: Percentage of health centres that have basic WASH facilities (urban)

actual.value: 2020:Services Availability and Readiness Assessment for health facilities is planned to be conducted in 2020 but not finalized
